pages.text: Myriacantherpestes was a 30 cm (just under 1 foot) long euphoberiid millipede that lived during the Carboniferous. It was characterized by having numerous spines growing from its body segments. Due to its strange appearance, a species in this group was originally mistaken as cycad seed! In its relative Euphoberia, aggregation behavior is known, so - admittedly speculatively - juvenile Myriacantherpestes might also have gathered together in groups

, possibly even defending themselves using noxious organic chemicals.$(br)$(br)$(br)$(l)Eats:$() Plants$(br)$(l)Breeds with:$() Plants$(br)$(l)Egg Type:$() Moss/Log$(br)$(l)Method of Obtaining:$() Egg Collection Phial
